I notice that in Kenneth's source code, half of the
recurrent links are loop links, others are not. like
this:

Genome::mutate_add_link(){
.....
      if (loop_recur) {
	nodenum1=randint(first_nonsensor,nodes.size()-1);
	nodenum2=nodenum1;
      }
      else {
	//Choose random nodenums
	nodenum1=randint(0,nodes.size()-1);
	nodenum2=randint(first_nonsensor,nodes.size()-1);
      }
.....
}

For a non loop recurrent link, input and output are
different node, and when a node activate, the
activation function don't check a link is recurrent or
not, it is used as normal link. code is in
Network::activate().

Then, what sense does it make for the existance of a
non loop recurrent link? Seems it behave exactly like
a normal link. Am I right?
